intro: Scytopetalum tieghemii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with prominent, spurred petals that resemble those of the buttercup. Its leaves are alternate, palmately lobed, and often covered in fine hairs. Scytopetalum tieghemii is typically found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
